title: Superdeep diamonds provide a window on supercontinent growth
description: Diamonds contain evidence of the mantle rocks that helped buoy and grow the ancient supercontinent Gondwana from below, according to new research from a team of scientists led by Suzette Timmerman—formerly of the University of Alberta and now at the University of Bern—and including Carnegie's Steven Shirey, Michael Walter, and Andrew Steele. Their findings, published in Nature, demonstrate that superdeep diamonds can provide a window through space and time into the supercontinent growth and formation process.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: Grandma chimps offer clues for evolution of menopause in humans
description: Humans and some whales are the only known species in which females live long after they stop being able to reproduce.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: What is a COP?
description: The crunch climate talks being held in Dubai from November 30 to December 12 will be the 28th such gathering of world leaders under UN auspices known as COPs.

album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: Vast destruction, 39 dead in Mexico after Acapulco hurricane
description: Acapulco was struggling Saturday to recover from the extraordinarily powerful Hurricane Otis, which claimed 39 lives and provoked widespread power, water and telephone outages.

album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: Can factory chicken really help save the climate?
description: Stephane Dahirel doesn't exactly say eat chicken and save the planet, but that is what he's hinting at as he opens a shed door on his intensive farm in Brittany, western France.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: How climate conscious Americans reduce their carbon footprints
description: Bala Sivaraman drives an electric car around the US capital Washington, buys used clothes and furniture and cooks his vegan meals on an induction stove he bought after parting ways with his gas oven.

album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: 1.5C goal on the line as countries gear up for key climate talks
description: Facing record-shattering temperatures and a geopolitical tinderbox, countries are scrambling to lay the groundwork for crucial UN climate talks next month tasked with salvaging global warming goals laid out in the landmark Paris deal.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: Mouse embryos grown in space for first time: Japan researchers
description: Mouse embryos have been grown on the International Space Station and developed normally in the first study indicating it could be possible for humans to reproduce in space, a group of Japanese scientists said.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
